bibl.title: The Terminology of Government in the Septuagint - in Comparison with Hebrew, Aramaic, and Other Languages.
bibl.note: Examines some of the main terminology for administrative offices in the Septuagint translation: satrãphw, strathgÒw, ¶parxow, êrxvn, topãrxhw, Ïparxow, "finance minister", §pistãthw, grammateÊw, eÈnoËxow, oﬁnoxÒow, Ípomnhmatogrãfow, basileÊw. <satrapes, strategos, eparchos, archon, toparches, huparchos, epistates, grammateus, eunouchos, oinochoos, hupomnematographos, basileus>
GRABBE Lester, The Terminology of Government in the Septuagint - in Comparison with Hebrew, Aramaic, and Other Languages.
Tessa RAJAK, Sarah PEARCE, James AITKEN and Jennifer DINES (Edd.), Jewish Perspectives on Hellenistic Rulers = Hellenistic Culture and Society. 50 (Berkeley - Los Angeles - London, 2007) pp. 225-237.
